channel.title: Eat the Strip | RSS Feed
channel.description: Eat the Strip is our tribute to the mom-and-pop food joints peppered across the Ottawa-Gatineau suburbs. We feel the folks who run these restaurants, diners and bars don't get the credit they deserve for contributing to our city's food culture. So, we created a review blog that only caters to strip mall gems.

item.title: Polka Delicatessen
item.description: It’s easy to overlook Polka Delicatessen, located in a strip mall between a cell phone repair shop and a make-your-own wine space. But step inside, and it’s clear this small, unassuming store has become a fixture for Ottawa’s Polish community—and for anyone craving a taste of authentic Eastern European deli fare....

item.title: Blue Diamond Bar & Grill
item.description: In the heart of Richmond, Blue Diamond Bar & Grill blends the best of both worlds: a family-friendly sports bar and a bustling small-town breakfast joint, all while serving up authentic Punjabi cuisine. ...

item.title: The Greek Souvlaki House
item.description: If you're craving authentic Greek flavours in a cozy, welcoming setting, look no further than The Greek Souvlaki House. This family-owned gem has been serving up delicious, home-cooked Greek classics since 2013. With its blue and white décor, reminiscent of the beautiful Greek islands, stepping inside feels like entering a warm, inviting home. It's the kind of place where regulars are greeted by name, and the smell of charbroiled meats fills the air....

item.title: Mr. Samoona Grill & Bakery
item.description: If you're ever driving down Bank Street and find yourself drawn to the tantalizing smell of sizzling meat and spices, follow your nose to Samoona. Nestled in a strip mall near Billings Bridge, this small but cozy Iraqi eatery has been quietly winning over food lovers since opening two years ago. Though it’s easy to miss at first, a stop here is more than worth it—especially if you're craving fresh, flavourful kebabs, creamy hummus, and homemade flatbreads....

item.title: Detola's Kitchen
item.description: I left work tonight craving Nigerian food—grilled meats, spicy curries, and pounded yams were all I could think of as I raced across the parking lot toward my car, with the temperature dropping to -13°C....

item.title: Chickpeas
item.description: For our last Eat the Strip outing of 2024, we headed east towards the Ottawa Train Yards....

item.title: Subtown
item.description: We were looking to try something different when we received an email recently from one of our readers about a place serving submarine sandwiches with an interesting twist....

item.title: La Maison du Kouign-Amann
item.description: My friend and former colleague Cynthia took me to Kanata to surprise me with some delicious baked treats back when we were in the throes of the pandemic....

item.title: Divisoria Market
item.description: Scouring strip malls can sometimes lead to gastronomic gold....

item.title: Delina's Restaurant and Bar
item.description: I often get a hankering for Ethiopian food....

item.title: Grounded Kitchen, Coffee & Bar
item.description: Grounded Kitchen, Coffee & Bar has always exuded good vibes, right from the moment I first handed in a resume, to the first day on the job, and now as a returning customer....

item.title: Yummy Touch Kitchen
item.description: We were told to take a healthy appetite to Yummy Touch Kitchen, a Middle Eastern restaurant that opened around a year ago in southeast Ottawa....

item.title: Saffron Kabab Restaurant
item.description: Our group of five arrived around dinnertime at Saffron Kabab Restaurant’s Bank Street location, just as the smell of marinated meats being grilled began to waft from the kitchen....

item.title: Safia Restaurant
item.description: When Ahmed Abdulkadir is not busy brokering peace deals in conflict zones, he’s busy making some of the best Somali flatbread in town at his family-run restaurant....

item.title: Thai Lanna
item.description: When we got wind of the fact that a restaurant in Ottawa’s south end may have received the blessings of the Thai embassy as authentic Thai cooking, we knew we had to visit....

item.title: Wei's Noodle House
item.description: For months we’ve had our vegan friends tell us about a hidden gem tucked away in the basement of a commercial building on Bronson Avenue....

item.title: Baa Desi Dine
item.description: I have been wanting to feature Baa Desi Dine ever since my partner brought home a take-out anda shami burger and beef kebab wrap. ...

item.title: Cindy's Restaurant
item.description: While getting older surely means fewer nights out, the desire to get a nice greasy spoon breakfast the morning after a night out hasn’t diminished....

item.title: The Tortilla Maker
item.description: It was around Thanksgiving last year that Eat the Strip reader Diodora suggested we head to Orleans to check out a Mexican takeout joint specializing in tortillas and salsas. ...

item.title: Soleil des Iles
item.description: Soleil des Iles is a no-nonsense Haitian restaurant tucked away in a gem of a strip mall in Vanier....

item.title: Meule et Caquelon
item.description: Rarely does one forget their first ever raclette....

item.title: Que pasa? Tacos
item.description: A tip from friends who were in the west end the other day caught us off guard....

item.title: Maki Sushi + Poke
item.description: In late June we received an email from one of our readers recommending we make a trip to Stittsville to try a new sushi place that was getting people in the area talking....

item.title: Saigon Bistro
item.description: It was in the spring of 2023, not too long after we launched Eat the Strip, that one of our readers wrote to us to check out Saigon Bistro....

item.title: Sherwood Market & Deli
item.description: Imagine walking into a small convenience store and seeing a lineup snaking around the aisles, leading up to a deli counter at the back....

item.title: Grenfell Catering
item.description: If it’s not already abundantly clear, there’s a special place in my heart for takeout joints that operate in industrial parks, sandwiched between business that usually have less to do with food and more to do with car parts. ...

item.title: Idriss Mediterranean
item.description: Idirss Mediterranean is one of those few restaurants that succeed in serving you amazing food all while capturing your imagination and transporting you to a distant land while you slowly slip into a food coma....

item.title: Brampton Authentic Indian Foods
item.description: Ravinder moved to Canada around the same time I arrived here to study at university. While we both were disappointed with the lack of authentic Punjabi fare in the Ottawa area, only one of us decided to do something about it....

item.title: Fishys Original Jerk
item.description: A nice evening with friends discussing Jamaican cuisine left us with, well, a hankering for Caribbean food....

item.title: Djakarta Taste
item.description: Indonesia. The country sounds as cool as the food is tasty. Thankfully, we didn’t have to travel quite as far to taste the flavours of this wonderful archipelago. ...

item.title: Chai Talks
item.description: Merivale Road has been dubbed an emerging little South Asia in Ottawa....

item.title: Ng's Cuisine
item.description: It’s no secret, Ng’s Cuisine serves some of the best Chinese food in Ottawa....

item.title: Sheikh Almandi
item.description: Not long ago, a long-time reader recommended an Iraqi spot in the west-end. ...

item.title: Sushi 29
item.description: A lot of Eat the Strip readers have written to us about good sushi joints recently....

item.title: Cedar Valley Lebanese Food
item.description: City council passed a motion this week to declare Ottawa the Shawarma Capital of Canada, so it was only fitting we went to break bread with the councillor who introduced the motion....

item.title: Nazli's Kitchen & Cafe
item.description: Next time you’re on the highway and see the exit to Carp, take it—your belly won’t regret it....

item.title: Bite & Bite Shanghai Fried Bun
item.description: I don’t know about you, but there are times I just crave true comfort food—wontons, buns and noodle soup. ...

item.title: Everest Cuisine
item.description: There’s nothing like hot momos to warm you up on a cold day....

item.title: Pizzalicious
item.description: Everywhere you look there seems to be a new pizza place popping up along Merivale Road....

item.title: Merivale Station Restaurant
item.description: Everything may be bigger in Texas, but have you been to Merivale Station Restaurant?...

item.title: Sona the Indian Kitchen
item.description: A taste of the homeland is never too far away in Ottawa....

item.title: Jasmine Bakery
item.description: It was a busy work week and all I could think of was meat pies to kick off the weekend. ...

item.title: Bienvenidos Latin Market
item.description: We glanced at the clock and realized we’d make it to Bienvenidos Latin Market half an hour before closing if we got out of the door right away....

item.title: Mellos Coffee Shop
item.description: Restaurants are popping up at such a dizzying pace on Merivale Road, south of Carling Avenue, that we can barely keep up. That said, there are some eateries in the neighbourhood that have withstood the test of time. We recently took a trip down Merivale Road—and memory lane—to pay homage to one such spot....

item.title: Sabaya Shack
item.description: We drove southeast towards city limits, hungry to try some legendary chicken wraps we had read about online....

item.title: Misto Fine Food Shop
item.description: I decided to stop by Misto Fine Food Shop on a recent visit to a nearby business....

item.title: Esther's Cakes N Sweets
item.description: When you’ve been baking for 15 years and finally open shop, you’re going to be pretty excited....

item.title: 3Cents Resto & Cafe
item.description: Faisal’s warm smile greeted us as we walked into 3Cents Resto & Café, a Yemeni café located in a strip mall off Bank Street. ...

item.title: Sadelko
item.description: Sadelko—a Cameroonian restaurant that opened just a few months ago in a mall—reminded us recently why Aylmer is one of our favourite food destinations in the region....

item.title: La Bocca Juice
item.description: A few months ago, I discovered La Bocca Juice, a Lebanese dessert shop located in the Towngate Shopping Centre on Bank Street....

item.title: Noodle's Invitation
item.description: I’d spent several months thinking of an email we received in September about a Chinese restaurant in a south-end industrial park....

item.title: My Thai Village
item.description: We hopped into a car with friends and family last Friday to test another strip mall gem, harbouring a hankering for Thai food after our original plans for the evening had fallen through....

item.title: Moul Hanout
item.description: Do yourself a solid and venture South on Bank Street, past Billings Bridge, in search of good Middle Eastern food....

item.title: Amma's Biryani
item.description: Long-time readers of Eat the Strip know we have a soft spot for eateries tucked away at the back of grocery stores....

item.title: Takedon Ottawa
item.description: Tucked away in the bowels of an office building on Price of Wales Drive is a new Japanese restaurant serving up delicious home-style food....

item.title: Adnan's Catering
item.description: We usually drive to Montreal to buy a specific type of kebab from the Indian subcontinent....

item.title: Bowman's Bar and Grill
item.description: When it comes to local watering holes, we’re not exactly spoiled for choice in Ottawa’s west-end Carlington neighbourhood....

item.title: Ottawa Falafel House
item.description: Disappointed in the quality of falafel around town, Ottawa Morning listener Mary Hayes wrote to us excitedly this spring when she discovered an east-end spot that serves excellent falafel....

item.title: Chelochi Grill
item.description: Persian food has always beckoned to me as someone who grew up in South Asia because of a shared culinary heritage between the Middle East and the Indian subcontinent. ...

item.title: Pookie's Thai
item.description: You can’t have a serious conversation about Ottawa’s best Thai food without Pookie’s Thai being in the mix....

item.title: Turkish Kebab House
item.description: Walking into the Turkish Kebab House in Kanata, you are immediately welcomed with the smiles from the owners, their families and around two dozen staff who work together to bring you authentic Turkish meats grilled on charcoal. ...

item.title: Takumi BBQ
item.description: There’s something special brewing at a small strip mall located next to a gas station on Merivale Road and Anna Avenue....

item.title: Schnitzel Works
item.description: Ever had those days where you wake up craving schnitzel?...

item.title: Caribbean Flavours Resto-Bar
item.description: Caribbean Flavours Resto-Bar is a new delight in our neighbourhood, having opened less than three months ago. If you’re driving south on Merivale Road from Carling Avenue, you could blink and miss it, but the colourful sign will hopefully catch your eye....

item.title: Cozy's Express
item.description: I’m not the first to crave an old-fashioned breakfast after a late night out, nor will I be the last. Fortunately, there are plenty of Eat the Strip readers who recommend strip-mall eateries that rise to the occasion. ...

item.title: La Cabaña
item.description: There’s no better sign of a strip mall gem than a grocery store that sells hot, fresh food....

item.title: Chahaya Malaysia
item.description: There is something special about being taken out for dinner when you need a little bit of cheering up. After a long, excruciating day of car hunting last year, this is how we discovered Chahaya Malaysia. While this esteemed establishment has been in Ottawa for many years—starting in the Glebe long ago before moving to Montreal Road—we were only lucky enough to discover it recently. Yet, the clientele has remained loyal and travel the extra mile for the sole Malaysian restaurant in Ottawa....

item.title: Asli Dining
item.description: My battery was running low, beeping at me every couple of minutes as honking cars whizzed past. Turns out dodging cars on Bank Street on an e-scooter can help build your appetite. So, by the time I reached Asli Dining, a Somali restaurant opened in 2017—and one of my new favourite restaurants—I was famished. ...

item.title: Baan Thai
item.description: A journey west can often lead you east....

item.title: Maple Delight Pizza
item.description: There seems to be a new pizza shop with desi offerings popping up every week outside the downtown core—and I, for one, am here for it....

item.title: Roberto's Corner
item.description: A lunchtime line-up for an Italian sandwich at the back of a gas station is always a good sign....

item.title: Noodle House 79
item.description: The LRT was down. A common enough experience for all of us living in Ottawa, but my friend Emma happened to be visiting from Halifax and was shocked at the two packed-to-the-windshield buses that we used to travel from downtown to Merivale and our ultimate destination of Noodle House 79....

item.title: Semsem
item.description: Leaving the BBQ joints of Austin behind, I found myself standing outside an unassuming gem of a restaurant in Ottawa during my weekend visit to my high-school friend, Ameya. ...

item.title: Run2Patty
item.description: If you live in Carlington, you may have noticed the scent of something delicious lingering at the corner of Shillington Avenue and Hollington Street....

item.title: Chili Craft Pizza
item.description: Saturdays in our household are busy. More so after running a six kilometre mud race. ...

item.title: Sundari's Kitchen
item.description: I knew Sundari’s Kitchen was doing something special when I spotted the menu during an Eat the Strip outing at an adjacent strip mall gem....

item.title: Mezbaan Restaurant
item.description: Growing up in a Delhi neighbourhood with a large Afghan refugee population, I grew accustomed to Afghan shops and restaurants on nearly every street corner. ...

item.title: Duna Bistro
item.description: After moving to the quiet suburban neighbourhood of Bells Corners in 2021, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised with the diverse cuisine choices of the many restaurants that are scattered in isolated strip malls along Robertson Road. Amongst the many, our favorite is in a small strip mall hidden behind the shadows of the large golden arches of the McDonalds at Moodie and Robertson Road—Duna Bistro....

item.title: Casa México
item.description: Our experience started as we hopped in an Uber on a rainy Saturday afternoon on our way to Casa Mexico, a restaurant located about 20 minutes out of downtown nestled in, of course, a strip mall. ...

item.title: Skela Foods
item.description: Move aside donair, there’s a new sheriff in town....

item.title: Shinwari BBQ and Pizza
item.description: There’s this amazing pizza place in Edinburgh called Pizza Pakwan that we went to three times in two weeks during our trip to Scotland in 2022....

item.title: Ali Baba Bakery
item.description: Middle Eastern meat pies have become a staple for us since we were introduced to them a few years ago. ...

item.title: Pita Bell Kabab Charcoal Grill
item.description: A hidden gem, if I’ve ever seen one....

item.title: Mona’s Café and Restaurant
item.description: After a later-than-usual Thursday evening out with some old pals from university, I woke up this morning with a hankering for baked beans, sausages and eggs....

item.title: Alhalabi
item.description: Sometimes, a tip pays off....

item.title: Palais Libanais
item.description: Everybody has their favourite shawarma place in Ottawa-Gatineau....

item.title: Punjabi Canteen
item.description: For our first Eat the Strip adventure, it was fitting that we chose something close to home....
